definitionGroups.group: One who shanks (in any of various senses).

entries.meaning: One who shanks a golf ball.
examples: Littler said he didn't shank it; rather he called it a soft pop-up, but us old hard-core shankers weren't so generous .

entries.meaning: One who glues the shank into a shoe.
examples: A shank-cutter cuts with a die that part of the shank which is composed of leather or leather board.  […]  A shanker tacks the shank in place, cuts away the superfluous upper leather gathered under the toe, beats the edge of the upper out  […]
